Script
W-Am: Sorry to bother you, but I’m wondering if either of you remember someone named James Pullman? He worked here at the newspaper a few months ago.
M-Au: That name doesn’t sound familiar. Why?
W-Am: Someone from Colby Media called today. James applied for a job there, and he listed our newspaper agency as his last place of employment. They asked for a recommendation, but I never actually worked with him.
M-Cn: James Pullman? I remember James. He was one of our staff photographers for about a year. He was very talented.
W-Am: Well, would you mind providing the recommendation then?
M-Cn: Sure, I’d be happy to, by I wish he had contacted one of us directly. That’s the usual procedure.

M: It is small, but with the patio space you could probably seat 20 people.
W: Q2 I’ve looked at another location up the street that is about 10% cheaper than this, so it’s a tough choice.
M: I see. Q3 Well, we can negotiate on the price. I’ll just have to talk to my manager first.
W: That would be great. If you can match their rental cost I would probably take this location because of the patio.
M: OK. Let me talk to my manager and get back to you.

W: You’re right. I shouldn’t hesitate anymore. My work is disrupted by my back pain almost every day.
M: If you would like, I can give you the number for Dr. Moran’s office. That way you can set up an appointment with him directly.

At Madox Technical, 86you'll receive the best car and truck repair training in the industry. We provide hands-on experience in real auto repair shops, which is a major advantage when applying for jobs. You can even apply by filling out the application form on your mobile phone. Before we start, 87l see most of you have a printout of last year’s course description. question.text: What  will the speaker do next?

FOCUS GROUP QUESTIONAIRE RESULTS:


Major respondents selected the following
Alright Ales New Styles Do you like the lable Do you like the flavor? Would you choose this again? Would you recommend this beer?
Dark Ale Yes No Maybe Maybe
Red Ale No Yes Yes Yes
Belgium Style Yes No No No
Wheat Ale Yes Yes Yes Yes

answer.explanation: Alright everyone, here’s the analysis of this year’s micro brew market shares. The good news is, Alright Ales is still in the top five small breweries in the Northcut region. Q1 The bad news is, the newest entry into our market, Strange Brew Ales, has a directly competing beer and is making strong gains. In order to stay competitive, we must be able to introduce new styles of craft beer to our consumers. Our analysts agree, if the current trend continues, Strange Brew Ales will bump US out of the top five by this time next year. Our master brewers have come up with four new styles of beer that we will introduce to a focus group at the upcoming Northcut Beer Festival. Q2 Once we get consumer feedback we will select the two most popular offerings and create an aggressive marketing campaign. Our sales must increase by at least 5% over the next quarter in order to maintain our market share in Northcut.

question.text: Why is Alright Ales worried?
choices: (B) They are nervous about their new beers,
(C) They are not in the top 5 of the market share in Northcut.
(D) They will have to cut staff.

question.text: What will the company likely do with the results of the survey?
choices: (A) Change the label of the Red Ale
(D) Start working on a new style of beer

question.text: Look at the graphic. What beer is least likely to be part of Alright Ales’ new product line?

answer.explanation: Good evening listeners! Here’s your WXRN traffic report. For anyone traveling near the city center, there are twenty-to thirty-minute delays entering the city, and traffic is backed up on the highways. As you know, our city is hosting the regional baseball tournament this week. It begins this afternoon in the stadium, and attendance is expected to reach around ten thousand. So if you have to commute into the city this week, we strongly encourage you to take the bus or the train.

question.text: What is the main topic of the broadcast?
According to the speaker, what will begin today?
What does the speaker suggest that listeners do?

answer.explanation: Hi, thanks for coming for this special meeting today. The reason I called everyone is to announce our new partnership with Walker Studios. As the CEO of Metro Studios, it is my great pleasure to witness this amazing opportunity to work with such a high caliber company like Walker Studios. They possess a number of studios that are capable of producing cutting edge quality 3-D films. This will allow our company to begin producing 3-D films. And why wouldn’t we? The majority of our films are science fiction, and I believe a transition into 3-D is an excellent path for US. I have ensured that we will have full access to Walker Studio’s equipment, and in return they will become a shareholder in our company. I suggest that our studio staff should spend the next following weeks studying how this new type of equipment works, so we can begin producing content as soon as possible.

question.text: What is the reason for the meeting?
What does the woman imply when she says “And why wouldn’t we?”
choices: (A) To suggest the partnership is good

answer.text: (A) To suggest the partnership is good

Script
M-Au: This is Harold Rosen, with WKRN News, Q1 reporting from the newly opened Bradford Opera House. The building is ultramodern, and when plans for its construction were announced, locals expressed their concern about it. It’s located right next to historic city hall, the oldest building in the city. But so far, residents who have visited seem to like it. In spite of its modern look, those who have been inside are impressed. The atrium is beautifully decorated, the theather is equipped with a state-of-the-art sound system, and, of course, the music program is specutacular. Q3 The schedule for this season’s performances can be found on the WKRN Web site.

answer.explanation: Hi, Ms. Patel. This is Shelly from Valley Landscape Company. Q1 l was working on your property today, and I took a look at the area where you wanted me to plant a flower garden. Q1&2 Well, the problem is, that area doesn't get much sun, so only a few types of flowers will grow there. I know you really liked the flowers you chose for that spot, but I hope you can be flexible. Q3 l left a catalog in your mailbox, and I suggest you look it over. I’d like to finish landscaping your yard this week, so please call me back and let me know your decision as soon as possible.

question.text: Why is the speaker calling the customer?
choices: (A) To discuss a problem with a project
(D) To apologize for a delayed order

answer.text: (A) To discuss a problem with a project

question.text: What does the speaker imply when she says hope you can be flexible ?
choices: (A) A different worker will complete a project.
(B)  A deadline will not be met.
(C) A product selection should be changed
(D) A price is higher than expected.

answer.text: (C) A product selection should be changed

question.text: What did the speaker leave for the customer?
Ms. Ling is not here today, but she _____ attends every library board meeting.

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning of words.

question.text: The restaurant has a _____ decorated room that is perfect for hosting children’s parties.

answer.explanation: Need 1 Adv- modify for Adj => Choose B.

question.text: Mr. Rinaldi supervised the construction of the new factory and ------- operations when it opens next June.

answer.explanation: " next June" is the signal of simple future tense.

question.text: With the completion of its airport, Honokai Island’s tourism _______ has improved dramatically.

answer.explanation:
Honokai Island’s tourism.......
=> Need a Noun to make a Noun phrase
Economy(n)
Economic (adj)
Economical (adj)
Economize (v)

question.text: To ensure prompt return of your laundry, ___ your hotel room number on the tag provided.

answer.explanation: We don't use any verb tense when giving instructions.

question.text: No passengers are allowed on board  _____  the aircraft’s door has been closed.

answer.explanation:
use conjunction
=> Choose C

question.text: Members of the Foster City Historical Society are petitioning to have ___ remains of the courthouse's original architectural elements preserved.

answer.explanation: What = Things

question.text: Osaka Box Company specializes in ___ packaging for long-distance transport of perishable foods.

answer.explanation: "Protective" means providing protection.

question.text: The LPN auto company has issued a special report to address concerns _____  the fuel efficiency of its vehicles.

answer.explanation:
Regarding + N
Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer
=> D

question.text: The manufacturing plant that was damaged in the typhoon should ______  its operations later this month.

answer.explanation: The position you need to fill in after "should", so the verb will be in the whole form.

question.text: Having proper ventilation throughout the building is _____ for protecting the health and well-being of the workers.

answer.explanation: Vocabulary question, based on the meaning of words to choose the right answer. => Choose C

question.text: All employees___to attend next Friday’s staff meeting.

answer.explanation: (C) This is a passive-voice sentence. The subject, “employees”, don’t perform the actions; somebody else encourages them. Choices (A), (B), and (D) are all active-voice forms.

question.text: During yesterday's meeting, Ms. Milne offered her  _____ to the sales team for their excellent results this quarter.

answer.explanation: Before the blank is the adjective, after the blank is the preposition so need to fill in a noun

question.text: Ms. Vialobos has reported that the new mobile telephones are the lightest ___ to be purchased by the department.

answer.explanation: The + superlative adj + ever to do st

question.text: Museum members are invited to preview the  historic portraits before the ------- opening of the exhibit on April 7.

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning of words.

question.text: City politicians will debate the ______  issue at the town hall meeting so that voters can have a better understanding of it.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of words
=> Choose C

question.text: Karl Byquist's compelling presentation ------- the management of Parkland Press to hire his company.

answer.explanation: According to the structure of noun (presentation) + verb + object (the management of ...) and because "presentation" is a singular noun

question.text: A reception will be held to introduce the newly _______ director of marketing to the employees of Kaulana Industries.
The easy-to-prepare meal packets come with all the ingredients necessary for an individual dinner _____ boiling water.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of words
=> Choose A

question.text: Employees must return to ___ work stations immediately after the lunch break.

answer.explanation: The answer comes before a noun so we choose "their".

question.text: Ms. Stevenson contacted the real estate agent  _____  name and phone number appeared on the advertisement.

question.text: The planned construction of several new office buildings in Newbury has created a _____ demand for skilled workers.

=> A

question.text: Complaints about its new line of kitchen appliances led Loxevo, Inc., to adopt higher _______for assessing quality.

Based on the meaning to choose the correct answer.
=> Choose A

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of words
=> Choose C

question.text: Due to congestion on the roads, an increasing number of manufacturers  _____  transport their goods by train.

answer.explanation:
The answers A, B, D are grammatically incorrect
=> Choose C

question.text: The chairperson ______ by an anonymous vote involving all members.

answer.explanation: I see in the sentence the expression "by"  so this sentence will be able to use the passive form.

question.text: Jorge was hired as an assistant manager five months ago, and ___ is now in line for a

answer.explanation: The answer is a subject so we use "he".

question.text: Requests for extra time off must___by the employee’s supervisor.

answer.explanation: (B) This is a passive idea. The subject, “requests”, receives the action of approval by the supervisor. Choices (A) and (C) are active-voice forms. Choice (D) is a noun.

question.text: Carideii Science Museum trustees are expected to be _______ of all the museum’s operations.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer
=> A

question.text:
MILAN, Italy—Few industries change as rapidly as the fashion industry, in which designers are constantly trying to create innovative versions of traditional garments. Even so, last week's fashion show in Milan was particularly notable for the vast number of garments made partly or entirely out of silk. From eveningwear to sportswear, many designers featured colorful silks in their collections.

The designers were likely responding to a market trend: a dramatically increased demand for colorful silk products. “Our sales of silk shirts and dresses have reached an all-time high,” said Christina Alvarez, a buyer for Gatsby’s in London. “Silk items have been flying off the racks.”

Economic analysts were surprised by the trend, since they had predicted that the rise of dry-cleaning costs would take a toll on silk manufacturers. However, comfort may have been a greater factor than price, especially given the unusually hot weather this past summer. “Today’s silk garments,” said Ms. Alvarez, “are lighter and cooler than many other types of clothing.”
What does the article discuss?
choices: (A)A growing demand for Italian dress designs
(B)An increase in the number of fashion shows each year
(C)A rise in the popularity of a certain clothing material
(D)A change in the cost of products made in England

answer.text: (C)A rise in the popularity of a certain clothing material
answer.explanation:
Based on some information: "last week's fashion show in Milan
was particularly notable for the vast number of garments made partly or entirely out of silk.", "The designers were likely responding to
a market trend: a dramatically increased demand for colorful silk products."

question.text: Where does Ms. Alvarez most likely work?

answer.explanation: Information in the sentence: "Our sales of silk shirts and dresses have reached an all-time high," said Christina Alvarez, a buyer for Gatsby's in London. "Silk items have been flying off the racks."

question.text:
Saponac State Park


Please note that www.newengIandcxplored.com, a popular commercial tourism Web site, lists 42 Millinockct Drive as the address of Saponac State Park. Be aware that this is the address for the park’s maintenance facilities, which are located on an unpaved road that is open only to park employees. The Saponac State Park Visitor Center and the official park entrance are located at 66 Debsconeag Way, about 32 miles from the maintenance building. Park visitors must use the park’s main entrance. All marked trails and guided walks begin in this area. From Elkdale, take Highway 82 north, use exit 558 for Ranch Road, and follow the signs approximately 8 miles to the park’s main entrance. All roads leading to the park’s main entrance are paved. For more information, call (207) 555-0117.

question.text:
Salty Sea in Rough Waters


by Sandra Lo

SINGAPORE (14 January) - Tourists in the know have been coming for years to the old pier-based seafood restaurant in the shape of a ship. --- [1] ---. The restaurant, Salty Sea, still stands, but the familiar wooden doors with their porthole windows are closed. All of the interior furniture was auctioned off in November, and the place is set to be demolished next month. --- [2] ---.
All is not as it seems, however. Salty Sea manager Nishit Kapoor has come to a hard-won agreement with the property owner, PG Realty, to rebuild the restaurant where it stands. --- [3] ---. According to Mr. Kapoor, PG Realty had decided to have the building torn down because the structure itself would have required massive repairs.
--- [4] ---. Any new structure built on the property will follow the original concept but have a more modern appearance. This comes at the insistence of PG Realty over the objections of Mr. Kapoor.
What is being reported?

answer.explanation:
Information in sentence: "All is not as it seems, however. Salty Sea
manager Nishit Kapoor has come to a hardwon agreement with the property owner, PG Realty, to rebuild the restaurant where it stands."

question.text: What is suggested about Mr. Kapoor?
choices: (A) He insisted on keeping the original design.
(B) He wants to leave the restaurant business.
(C) He is looking for a new location.
(D) He turned a ship into a restaurant.

answer.text: (A) He insisted on keeping the original design.
answer.explanation: Information in sentence: "Any new structure built on the property will follow the original concept but have a more modern appearance."

question.text:
In which of the positions marked [1], [2], [3], and [4] does the following sentence best belong?
"Among the objects sold was a scale model of the 150-year-old ship that inspired the restaurant's design."

answer.explanation: This sentence is related to the previous sentence "All of the interior furniture was auctioned off in November, and the place is set to be demolished next month."

question.text:
Woodsmith, Inc

We are pleased you have purchased handmade, hard wood furniture form Woodsmith, Inc, of Vancouver. We are proud of our long heritage and are confident you will appreciate the quality and craftsmanship that went into the making of your product. Our furniture is meant to last a lifetime. That is why we make every effort to inform our customers how best to treat it. We recommend the following.

• Use cleaning products that are made specifically for wood such as Bly’s Wood Cleaner. Avoid multisurface cleaners, as these may leave streaks or an oily residue.
• To brighten a surface that has dulled, use a paste wax such as Russ Wax. Apply the wax no more than twice per year. Remove the old wax first with a mild, nonalkaline soap-and-water solution.
• Avoid wiping the furniture with a dry cloth, as this may leave hairline scratches on the finish.
• Avoid placing the furniture directly in front of radiators, heating ducts, and fireplaces.
• Do not expose the furniture to direct sunlight, as this may lead to fading.

We wish you a lifetime of enjoyment from your furniture. We appreciate your business, and we welcome your comments and suggestions. Simply call 604-555-0144 during regular business
What does the information mainly discuss?
choices: (B) Where to shop for a product
(C) How to care for a product

answer.text: (C) How to care for a product
answer.explanation: Information in the sentence: "That is why we make every effort to inform our customers how best to treat it." Additionally, you should skim the passage to get the general idea.

question.text: What is indicated about Woodsmith, Inc.?
choices: (A) Its stores are closed on weekends.
(D) Its products are manufactured by hand

answer.text: (D) Its products are manufactured by hand
answer.explanation: Information in the sentence: "We are pleased you have purchased handmade, hard wood furniture form Woodsmith, Inc, of Vancouver."

question.text: According to the information, what could happen to hardwood furniture in direct sunlight?

answer.explanation: Information in the sentence: 'Do not expose the furniture to direct sunlight, as this may lead to fading."

If you prefer to search tor polls by subject, go to our Subject Guide page. question.text: From Coins to Credit: Banking Throughout the Ages is a concise history of banks and the banking industry from ancient times to the present. James Gallagher, who has made a career of covering financial news for several newspapers, has done a careful job of investigating his subject Although he presents the facts carefully, Mr. Gallagher has made what could have been a dry book into one that is interesting and enjoyable. By telling amusing anecdotes about historical figures, he makes them come alive. Even people who are not particularly attracted to the subject matter will find this book engrossing.

question.text:
Travel & Recreation

123 Gilmore street

Orange County, CA 48857


November 15
Mr. Peter Kang
3820 Rivervalley Heights
Seattle, WA 19387

We at Travel & Recreation thank you for your subscription to our magazine. As you have been a long time subscriber, I am excited to inform you about our new subscription plan for our VIP members. - [1] - As a member, you will continue to receive monthly editions of our magazine and access to our new online e-magazine services. You can simply download a digital version of the print magazine to any mobile device at no extra cost. -[2] - Furthermore, you can access background information about our authors, journalists, and guest writers, as well as detailed information about the locations and places that are covered in the magazine. In addition, you can access the recipes to the most popular restaurants around the world and, most exciting of all, we will hold an exclusive competition for our VIP members with a chance to win a trip for two to Hawaii. -[3] - Our regular subcribers, as well as VIP members, will have a chance to win a dining experience at 5-star restaurant Bellisimo.

Again we thank you for your continued support and we hope you enjoy the many changes we have made to our services as we strive to entertain and educate our loyal subscribers. - [4] - Please fill out the application form that is attached to this letter. Please check which subscription plan you wish to join. If you send in a $100 fee, you will receive the regular subscription plan. If you send in $200 fee, you will become a VIP member.

We appreciate your support and hope to hear from you soon.

Sincerely,
Victoria Adams
Why was a letter sent to Mr. Kang?
choices: (A) To remind him to send in his travel journals
(B) To explain about a new subscription plan
(C) To inquire about his travel plans
(D) To determine his qualifications for a position

answer.text: (B) To explain about a new subscription plan
answer.explanation: The information is in: "As you have been a long time subscriber, I am excited to inform you about our new subscription plan for our VIP members.'

question.text: What did Ms. Adams send with the letter?

answer.explanation: Based on the information in: "Please fill out the application form that is attached to this letter. ", we can see that Ms. Adam send an application form with the letter.

question.text: In the middle of the first paragraph of the letter, the term “at no extra cost” is closest in meaning to:

answer.explanation:
extra cost: added cost to normal cost
no extra cost means no more or no added cost, which has the same meaning with free.

question.text:
In which of the positions marked [1], [2], [3] and [4] does the following sentence belong?
“Your subscription expires next month, but we invite you to consider joining our VIP membership.”

answer.explanation: In the second sentence of the letter, Ms. Adam mentioned about VIP members. And in the following sentence after [1], she also wrote: "As a member, you will continue to receive monthly editions of our magazine and access to our new online e-magazine services." which is related to subscription and membership.

question.text:
Chocolatier's Pavilion Mobbed
BERLIN (15 AUGUST) — The International Food Expo kicked off earlier this week, and it quickly became clear which pavilions are attracting the most interest from attendees at the weeklong event. From the moment it opened, the pavilion featuring the Brazilian chocolatier Amo-Te has been overrun with enthusiastic visitors.
"We didn't expect to be so popular," remarked company Marketing Manager Andreas Gomes, who arrived at the expo just in time to see his company's artisanal confectioners explain the chocolate-making process to eager crowds. “ We drew so many visitors that I had to fly in five more employees from our headquarters in Brazil to staff our busy display area.”
Vintage products that Amo-Te no longer distributes to retailers have been released in limited quantities. One exclusively available at the Expo is the once-popular bar made from dried fruit and covered with dark chocolate. The company has reproduced this old favorite in a classic, retro-style wrapper.
“We were confident that our appeal to chocolate-lovers' sense of nostalgia would be welcome,” said Mr. Gomes, “but we never expected this kind of success!”
=================

=================
According to the article, what action did Mr. Gomes have to take?
choices: (C)  Bringing extra workers to the event
(D)  Shipping additional samples to staff at the expo

answer.text: (C)  Bringing extra workers to the event
answer.explanation: “We drew so many visitors that I had to fly in five more employees from our headquarters in Brazil to staff our busy display area.”

question.text: In the article, the word "drew” in paragraph 2, line 6, is closest in meaning to

answer.explanation: In the context of this article, it can be seen that the meaning of 3 options A, B, C is inappropriate. The word "drew" here means "attract, attract", the closest meaning to "attracted".

question.text: On what day did Mr. Gomes likely arrive at the expo?

answer.explanation: “remarked company Marketing Manager Andreas Gomes, who arrived at the expo just in time to see his company's artisanal confectioners explain the chocolate-making process to eager crowds."

question.text: Which product was produced specifically for the expo?

answer.explanation: “One exclusively available at the Expo is the once-popular bar made from dried fruit and covered with dark chocolate”....“the legendary dried-fruit and dark-chocolate Carpatho”

(D) It is a traditional Brazilian treat.

answer.text: (B) It is not yet available in stores.

question.text:
http://www.acetraining.com
Ace Training is a company that offers developmental courses for the employees of your store or business. You can rely on our team of successful professionals to improve the quality of your staff and help your company achieve its goals. We provide effective and results-oriented programs. Below are the training courses available:
Home Contact Us Location About Ace
Leadership
This program helps staff members develop strategic planning and management skills. It also enhances the supervisory skills of the employees in leadership positions.
Customer Service
Never undervalue the importance of your customers’ satisfaction. Your employees need the skills to become helpful and efficient when working directly with customers.
Sales
We teach innovative strategies to increase sales and market share. This class is suitable for both salespeople in a store and employees who work over the phone.
Technologies
In rapidly changing work environments, staff members should keep up with new trends and developments in the technological field. Your staff members will learn how to research and master new technologies quickly and accurately.


===========================

From: Tiffany Tran - tifftran@zellengifts.com
To: Joshua York - josh@acestafftraining.com
Subject:Staff Training for Our Employees
Date: October 9

Dear Mr. York,
I’m contacting you about running a training program for some of our employees here at Zellen Gifts. We are planning on expanding our telemarketing department next month, but we don’t have enough properly trained employees to fill these new positions. Therefore, we will be transferring some employees from the customer service department to the telemarketing department to solve this problem. As our products are mainly targeted towards children, we are hoping to increase our profits as much as possible for this Christmas season. Please let me know the maximum number of students that you can accommodate at one time.

Thank you,
Tiffany Tran Zellen Gifts

===============================


 

PROPOSED ACE TRAINING SCHEDULE FOR ZELLEN GIFTS

November 1-5

Group Code and Student Numbers Monday Sales Strategies Tuesday Successful Negotiation Wednesday Customers First! Thursday Closing the Deal Friday Start Polite, Stay Polite
Red Team 10 people 9:00 – 11:00 9:00-11:30 8:00 – 10:30 8:00 – 11:00 9:00 -11:00
Blue Team 10 people 1:00 – 3:00 1:00 – 3:00 1:00 – 3:00 1:00 – 3:00 1:00 – 3:00
Green Team 10 people 3:00 – 5:00 3:00 – 5:00 3:00 – 5:00 3:00 – 5:00 3:00 – 5:00
White Team 10 people 5:00 – 7:00 5:00 – 7:00 5:00 – 7:00 5:00 – 7:00 5:00 – 7:00


Here is our proposed schedule for transitioning your customer service staff into successful telemarketers. You can see that we have an ambitious amount of material to cover, but I am confident it will be a success. We have tried to balance your need for a swift transition with your need to continue running Zellen Gifts while the training is in session. Therefore, we divided your staff into groups and staggered them throughout the day. This will result in better student-to-trainer numbers for your staff, and it should cause minimal disruptions in your business. We look forward to a great week of training!

Joshua York
Ace Training Coordinator
What is indicated by the proposed training schedule and accompanying memo?
choices: (A)It is an easy course to complete.
(B)There are 5 key topics that will be covered.
(D)Joshua York will be one of the trainers.

answer.text: (B)There are 5 key topics that will be covered.

question.text: What is stated about the program on technologies?

answer.explanation: Information in the introduction sentence “staff members should keep up with new trends and play in the technological field.”

question.text: Where does Mr. York work?

answer.explanation: From Email content, it can be seen that Tiffany sent an email to Mr. York to organize a training course for staff. So Mr. York is most likely to work in a training organization

question.text: Based upon the proposed training schedule and accompanying memo, what can be inferred about Zellen Gifts?
choices: (A)They are trying to become better at customer relations.
(B)They are trying to conduct business as normal during their training period.
(C)They have a small customer service staff.
(D)They want to finish their training before the end of October

answer.text: (B)They are trying to conduct business as normal during their training period.
answer.explanation: Information can be deduced by the sentence “We have tried to balance your need for a swift transition with your need to continue running Zellen Gifts while the training is in session ”

question.text: In what program is Ms. Tran most likely interested?

answer.explanation:
From email, “We are planning on expanding our telemarketing department next month, but we don't have enough properly trained employees to fill these new positions ”(We are planning to expand our telemarketing department next month, but we do not have enough trained staff suitable for new positions)
That means Ms. Tran is interested in telemarketing training. Of the answers given, it was the most relevant to sales.

question.text:
Attention Passengers

Clinton Bus Lines

In response to customer feedback, Clinton Bus Lines will be expanding its bus routes connecting Texas to other metropolitan centers in the Southwest, starting on May 1, the new routes listed below will take effect. In order to promote these new bus lines, we will be offering tickets at half price during the first week of operation. Improving your satisfaction is our main priority. To get more detailed information such as departure and arrival times, please visit our website at www.clintonbusses.com.

• From Dallas Bus Terminal to Phoenix, Arizona Bus Terminal
• From Austin Bus Terminal to Santa Fe, New Mexico Bus Terminal
• From Fort Worth Bus Terminal to Denver, Colorado Bus Terminal

=========================

To: erichanson@prplanning.com
From: dangregory@trentonlogistics.com
Date:April 27
Subject: Upcoming Visit

Dear Mr. Hanson,
I am currently finalizing all the details for my visit to your company’s headquarters in Santa Fe. Thank you for inviting me down to take part in these business negotiations. Please let me know what time I should arrive. Will the meeting begin after lunchtime like it did last time?
You won’t need to pick up me up, as I have arranged for a cab to pick me up at the Santa Fe Bus Terminal. Fortunately, a new bus line was established between where I live and your offices. It has made transit in the Southwestern region considerably convenient.
There are routes that now travel to Denver and Phoenix as well. Also, thanks to some lucky circumstances, I will be able to buy my ticket to Santa Fe at half the original price.
I can’t wait to see you and your co-workers again soon.
Dan Gregory
Where does Mr. Gregory most likely live?

answer.explanation: From “I have arranged for a cab to pick me up at the Santa Fe Bus Terminal ”(I have arranged a taxi to pick up at the Santa Fe bus stop), it can be deduced that Gregory took the bus with the Santa Fe terminal. See in the notice the trip started in Austin. In the email, Mr. Gregory also said that the bus line runs between where he lives and Hanson's office. So Gregory is most likely to live in Austin.

question.text: What is indicated about Mr. Gregory’s previous meeting with Mr. Hanson?
choices: (D) It was canceled due to bad weather.

answer.explanation: Inferred from the last sentence of paragraph 1 of the email "Will the meeting begin after lunchtime like it did last time?

question.text: According to the notice, what are Clinton Bus Lines passengers encouraged to do on the website?

answer.explanation: Information on the last sentence in the notice "For more detailed information such as departure and arrival times, please visit our website at www.clintonbusses.com."

question.text: When is the meeting scheduled to take place?

answer.explanation: In the email, Gregory said that he had bought a bus ticket for half the original price. According to the announcement, the new bus service will have this price in the first week of operation. The new bus routes start on May 1, so this rate will end on May 7th. Hence the meeting will take place between these two timelines.

question.text: In the e-mail, the word “transit” in paragraph 2, line 3, is closest in meaning to

answer.explanation: Based on meaning to choose the correct answer

question.text:
Summer Lecture Series

Sponsored by the Department of City Planning at Wurnster University

The Department of City Planning is excited to announce a summer lecture series that will be focusing on budgeting issues that concern local residents and municipalities. Financial management is one of the most important duties of local government's operations. We hope to improve the status of budgeting at the local government level across the nation through community involvement and participation. All lectures will be held in the Hayston Building on the Wurnster campus.

> Monday, February 1, 6:00 P.M., Room 401
Speaker:Tim Powell, Professor of Policy Analysis at Wurnster University
Strategic Planning —Learn how to develop budgets in order to monitor progress toward community goals and successful outcomes.

> Wednesday, February 3, 7:00 P.M., Room 305
Speaker: Melissa Simmons, Kennedy Institute for Policy Making
Focusing on Our Children —Studies show that building playgrounds and sports facilities for children helps make better communities.

> Monday, February 8, 6:00 P.M., Room 202
Speaker: Hank Ross, Michigan Municipal League
Managing Our County's Parks —Learn how to preserve our local parks as a valuable community resource.

> Wednesday, February 10, 5:30 P.M., Room 404
Speaker: Scott Watson, Executive Director, Local Government Academy
Economic Opportunities and Local Ecology —Economic opportunity is often accompanied by potential risks to the surrounding ecosystem, and balancing the two can be difficult.

Please contact Patricia Flores at pfloresiawurnster.edu for additional information.

==============================

To: Patricia Flores (pflores@wurnster.edu)
From:Jake Patter (sonjpatterson@wurnster.edu)
Subject:Lecture Series
Date:January 24

Dear Ms. Flores,

I work for Facilities Management here at Wurnster University. It was recently brought to my attention that there is a scheduling conflict concerning one of your lecture dates. Room 305 has been reserved for every Wednesday this semester by the Wurnster Debate Club. Therefore, I’m sorry to inform you that you will need to move the location or the time of this talk. You can visit the facilities management website in order to check the availability of other room locations and reschedule the talk.

Jake Patterson
Who most likely is the lecture series intended for?

answer.explanation:
Read the first sentence of the first paragraph:

The Department of City Planning is excited to announce a summer lecture series that will be focusing on budgeting issues that concern local resident and municipalities.

question.text: What is Ms. Flores instructed to do on a website?

answer.explanation:
Information is at the last sentence of the email “You can visit the facilities management website in order to check the availability of other room locations and reschedule the talk.”
So, Ms. Flores was instructed to access the website to change the lecture room reservation.

question.text: What most likely will be discussed at the lecture on February 10?

answer.explanation: The theme of the February 10 lecture was “Economic Opportunities and Local Ecology”, which talked about how to balance economic opportunities with environmental destruction impacts. So answer C is the most suitable.

question.text: In the brochure, the word “through” in paragraph 1, line 5, is closest in meaning to

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning to choose the correct answer

question.text: According to Mr. Patterson, whose lecture must be rescheduled?

answer.explanation: According to email, room 305 has been reserved in advance, and lectures taking place there must be rescheduled or rescheduled. To compare with the announcement, room 305 is the lecture site of speaker Simmon.

question.text:
Tech Life Hires New CEO

New York, April 12 — Amid a crisis of low sales and disappointing performance, the technology company Tech Life has hired Steve Cross as its new chief executive officer. Previously, he was the chief financial officer at the technology investment firm Esta Resources in San Francisco, California. He assumed the position of CEO at the company—based in Dallas, Texas—just this Monday. Stockholders voted unanimously for the appointment, hoping the new CEO will bring renewed vitality and strength to the company. Mr. Cross has an impressive record as a business leader who makes smart decisions," commented Lynn Dyer, the director of human resources at Tech Life. "We have faith that he will lead US in a new direction that will help develop new markets and optimize our company operations in general."
Steve Cross graduated from Chester University in Harrisburg, Pennsylvania, with a master's degree in business administration. He once served as head of the American League of Business Leaders and is a dedicated family man.

===========================

To:Steve Cross- scross@techlife.com
From:Lynn Dyer - ldyer@techlife.com
Subject: Welcome!
Date:April 15
Dear Mr. Cross,

It has been almost two years since we met. I am so glad to be collaborating with you again after we worked in the same department at Esta Resources. I felt we cooperated very well at that time, and I had been hoping to work with you again. You will find that we have very dedicated and hard-working teams here. If there is anything I can do to help you make the transition, please don’t hesitate to ask.
Additionally, Tech Life has recently added five new managers to our company. If you have time, please visit them when they will all be attending a mandatory training session at 3:00 RM. this afternoon in Room 403.

Sincerely,
Lynn Dyer
Director of Human Resources Tech Life
What problem is Tech Life facing?

answer.explanation: “Amid a crisis of low sales and disappointing performance ”

question.text: What is mentioned about the shareholders?
choices: (A) They are allowed to share financial information.
(B) They will hold a meeting next week.
(D) They agreed on the appointment of a new leader.

answer.text: (D) They agreed on the appointment of a new leader.
answer.explanation: “Stockholders voted unanimously for the appointment, hoping the new CEO will bring renewed vitality and strength to the company”

question.text: In the article, the word “optimize” in paragraph 2, line 6, is closest in meaning to

answer.explanation: End of paragraph 2: "... optimize our company operations in general"

question.text: Where did Ms. Dyer work previously?

answer.explanation:
* In the article: he (Steve Cross) was the chief financial officer at... Esta Resources in San Francisco, California.
Steve Cross is CFO at... Esta Resources in San Francisco, California.

In the email: we worked in the same department at Esta Resources CFO at... Esta Resources in San Francisco, California.

question.text: What is Mr. Cross asked to do?

answer.explanation: In the email, paragraph 2: If you have time, please visit them (new managers) when they will all be attending a mandatory training session at 3:00 PM...
